senses.de: Related to the body, as opposed to the mind or spirit
senses.ex: She is in good physical health after going to gym regularly

Tips.title: Body and Health
Tips.description: Emphasizes the condition or aspects of the human body, not emotion or intellect.
Tips.example: Regular exercise improves your physical state.

Tips.title: Not Mental
Tips.description: 'Physical' contrasts with mental activities; it's about the corporeal world.
Tips.example: Chess is mental, while swimming is physical.

senses.ex: Football is a very physical sport

Tips.title: Touch and Impact
Tips.description: Often implies the sense of touch or actual collision or contact.
Tips.example: The play had several physical confrontations.

Tips.title: Not Always Violent
Tips.description: Physical interaction can be gentle, like a handshake, not just aggressive.
Tips.example: Their physical greeting was a warm hug.

senses.de: Related to material things or natural sciences
senses.ex: The physical properties of a gas

Tips.title: Observable Qualities
Tips.description: Refers to qualities that can be seen, felt, or measured, not abstract.
Tips.example: Ice's physical state changes when it melts.

Tips.title: Not Theoretical
Tips.description: Physical science deals with concrete natural phenomena, unlike theoretical science.
Tips.example: Studying the physical structure of DNA requires observation.

Tips.title: Real-world Application
Tips.description: Emphasizes practical experiments and evidence in the physical world.
Tips.example: Engineers test the physical durability of materials.

senses.ex: They were involved in a physical relationship

Tips.title: Physical Connection
Tips.description: The term may imply a romantic or sexual aspect, involving bodily closeness.
Tips.example: Their dance routine was very physical.

senses.ex: I am going for my annual physical later today

Tips.title: Medical Check
Tips.description: A 'physical' in medical terms means a thorough health examination by a doctor.
Tips.example: He passed his physical with flying colors.

Tips.title: Routine Assessment
Tips.description: A physical is a regular check-up; it doesn't imply illness or medical issue.
Tips.example: The job requires an annual physical.

Tips.title: Preventive Healthcare
Tips.description: Getting a physical is part of staying healthy, not just diagnosing problems.
Tips.example: She schedules a physical every year as a precaution.

Bodily.wordDefinition:
Bodily relates to the body, or physical being of a person, while physical relates to the overall physical world.

For example, if someone says they have bodily pain, it means there is pain in the physical sensations of their body.

Bodily is more specific to the physical body of an individual while physical can encompass a broader range of objects or phenomena in the physical world.

Concrete.wordDefinition:
Concrete refers to something that is tangible and can be perceived through the senses such as touch, sight, or hearing.

For example, a concrete object would be something like a book or a table that you can physically touch and see. Physical refers to anything related to the body or material world.

Concrete refers to tangible, material things, while physical refers to anything related to the body or material world – both tangible and intangible.

Corporeal.wordDefinition:
Corporeal refers to something related to the physical body, whereas physical refers to something related to the material world.

For example, when we say a person is corporeal, we are referring to their physical body, whereas when we say something is physical, we can be referring to anything tangible or material, such as objects or substances.

Corporeal is often used in medical or scientific contexts to describe bodily functions, whereas physical is more commonly used in everyday speech to describe things we can see, touch, or feel.

Material.wordDefinition:
Material refers to objects that are made of matter, such as wood, metal, plastic, and fabric.

It can also refer to things that are important or relevant, like "material evidence" in a court case.

Material refers to the substance or composition of an object, while physical refers to its observable properties or characteristics.

Palpable.wordDefinition:
Palpable and physical are two words that have some similarities but also differences.

Palpable means something that can be felt or touched, often metaphorically. For example, tension in a room can be palpable or emotions can be palpable.

Palpable usually describes something that is not easily seen but can be sensed through touch or feeling.

The main difference between the two words is that palpable describes something that is sensed through touch or feeling, while physical describes something that is seen or touched physically.

Solid.wordDefinition:
Solid refers to an object that has a definite shape and volume, and it is one of the three states of matter (the other two are liquid and gas).

Solids hold their shape and cannot be compressed easily. For example, a rock is a solid because it has a fixed size and shape.

Physical can be used broadly for anything related to the body or energy, whereas solid is specifically for a state of matter with a definite shape and volume.

Substantial.wordDefinition:
Substantial refers to something that is significant, important, or considerable. It is related to the idea of quality, mass, or impact, rather than to its materiality.

However, in order to be substantial, it has to meet certain requirements, such as being functional, safe, attractive, and useful.

However, in order to be substantial, it has to reflect their well-being, vitality, and quality of life, which may depend on other factors, such as their diet, exercise, sleep, or mental state.

In summary, physicality refers to the material aspect of things, while substantiality refers to their meaningfulness, value, or impact.

Tangible.wordDefinition:
Tangible refers to things that can be touched or felt but doesn't necessarily have a physical form.

It can apply to abstract concepts or ideas that can be experienced or understood by the senses. For example, an idea can be tangible because you can understand and visualize it, even if you can't touch it.

The word physical refers to concrete objects or phenomena that occupy physical space, while the word tangible refers to things that can be sensed or experienced, regardless of their physical form.

quotes.Text: A mind at peace, a mind centered and not focused on harming others, is stronger than any physical force in the universe.
quotes.Title: American Psychologist
quotes.Name: Wayne Dyer

quotes.Text: I believe there are no questions that science can't answer about a physical universe.
quotes.Title: English Physicist
quotes.Name: Stephen Hawking

quotes.Text: If we were all perfected beings, we wouldn't be here in the physical world.
quotes.Title: British Musician
quotes.Name: George Harrison

quotes.Text: I am always physically and emotionally invested in the characters I play.
quotes.Title: Indian Actress
quotes.Name: Shweta Tripathi

quotes.Text: It's very important to work myself physically as hard as I can.
quotes.Title: American Dancer
quotes.Name: Twyla Tharp

quotes.Text: I learned that moral courage is harder than physical courage.
quotes.Title: American Author
quotes.Name: Tim O'Brien

quotes.Text: I've certainly experienced physical pain in my life.
quotes.Title: American Athlete
quotes.Name: Katey Sagal

quotes.Text: Working out is so mentally and physically important.
quotes.Title: American Businesswoman
quotes.Name: Payal Kadakia

quotes.Text: There's more to life than physical and material.
quotes.Title: Jamaican Musician
quotes.Name: Ziggy Marley
